intro: Peucedanum pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf cow parsley, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few centimeters, making it a low-growing species. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. Due to its limited distribution and fragile nature, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
